summary: The Puppy Protection Act of 2025 seeks to amend the Animal Welfare Act. It introduces stricter requirements for dog dealers, focusing on humane treatment. Key provisions include standards for housing (solid flooring, appropriate space, temperature control), food and water, exercise, socialization, veterinary care (including vaccinations and parasite prevention), and safe breeding practices. The bill also mandates efforts to find humane placement for retired breeding dogs. It directs the Secretary to issue final regulations within 18 months of enactment.
